criteria: Application of Refusal Skills in Scenarios
descriptions: Shows no understanding of how diseases spread.
Displays a very basic understanding of disease transmission, with significant gaps.
Understands some common ways diseases spread, but misses key details or specific scenarios.
Demonstrates a good understanding of disease transmission methods, including direct and indirect contact.
Exhibits a comprehensive understanding of various disease transmission methods and factors influencing spread.
Demonstrates expert understanding of disease transmission, including complex scenarios and nuanced factors; able to explain routes of transmission clearly.
Unable to identify any refusal strategies.
Identifies one or two refusal strategies, but they are weak or inappropriate.
Identifies a few refusal strategies, but struggles to apply them to specific scenarios.
Can identify several effective refusal strategies suitable for different situations.
Demonstrates a wide range of refusal strategies and can adapt them to diverse and challenging situations.
Expertly identifies and tailors refusal strategies; demonstrates a deep understanding of effective communication and assertiveness techniques.
Unable to apply refusal skills in any scenario.
Attempts to apply refusal skills, but does so ineffectively or inappropriately.
Applies refusal skills in simple scenarios, but struggles with more complex or peer-pressure situations.
Effectively applies refusal skills in a variety of scenarios, including those involving peer pressure.
Consistently and confidently applies refusal skills in diverse and challenging scenarios.
Masterfully applies and adapts refusal skills; demonstrates exceptional assertiveness, communication skills, and the ability to navigate high-pressure situations.
Response is unclear and demonstrates little to no effective communication.
Response is difficult to understand; communication is weak and lacks clarity.
Response is somewhat clear but lacks detail; communication is basic.
Response is clear and easy to understand; communication is effective.
Response is very clear, well-articulated, and persuasive; communication is highly effective.
Response is exceptionally clear, articulate, and compelling; communication is masterful.
